com.orientechnologies.common.directmemory

Class OByteBufferPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.orientechnologies.common.directmemory.OByteBufferPool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OByteBufferPoolMXBean, OOrientShutdownListener

    public class OByteBufferPool
extends Object
implements OOrientShutdownListener, OByteBufferPoolMXBean
    Object of this class works at the same time as factory for DirectByteBuffer objects and pool for DirectByteBuffer objects which were used and now are free to be reused by other parts of the code.

    All DirectByteBuffer objects have the same size which is specified in objects constructor as "page size". Despite of the fact that size of page is relatively small memory may be acquired from OS in relatively big chunks. It is done to optimize memory usage inside of database.

    See Also:
    OGlobalConfiguration.MEMORY_CHUNK_SIZE

      • OByteBufferPool

        public OByteBufferPool(int pageSize,
                       int maxChunkSize,
                       long preAllocationLimit)
        Parameters:
        pageSize - Size of single page (DirectByteBuffer) returned by pool.
        maxChunkSize - Maximum allocation chunk size
        preAllocationLimit - Limit of memory which will be allocated by big chunks

    • Method Detail

      • instance

        public static OByteBufferPool instance()
        Pool returned by this method is used in all components of storage. Memory used by this pool is preallocated by chunks with size not more than OGlobalConfiguration.MEMORY_CHUNK_SIZE Amount of maximum memory preallocated by this pool equals to sum of OGlobalConfiguration.DISK_CACHE_SIZE and OGlobalConfiguration.WAL_CACHE_SIZE and one.

        Size of single page equals to OGlobalConfiguration.DISK_CACHE_PAGE_SIZE.

        Returns:
        Global instance is used inside of storage.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        Amount of pages which are available in pool. Pages which were allocated and now not used.

      • getMaxPagesPerChunk

        public int getMaxPagesPerChunk()
        Returns:
        Maximum amount of pages in single preallocate memory chunk.

      • acquireDirect

        public ByteBuffer acquireDirect(boolean clear)
        Acquires direct memory buffer. If there is free (already released) direct memory buffer we reuse it, otherwise either new memory chunk is allocated from direct memory or slice of already preallocated memory chunk is used as new byte buffer instance.

        If we reached maximum amount of preallocated memory chunks then small portion of direct memory equals to page size is allocated. Byte order of returned direct memory buffer equals to native byte order.

        Position of returned buffer is always zero.

        Parameters:
        clear - Whether returned buffer should be filled with zeros before return.
        Returns:
        Direct memory buffer instance.

      • release

        public void release(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Put buffer which is not used any more back to the pool.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Not used instance of buffer.

      • verifyState

        public void verifyState()
        Verifies the state of this byte buffer pool for a consistency, leaks, etc. OGlobalConfiguration.DIRECT_MEMORY_TRACK_MODE must be on, otherwise this method does nothing. Detected problems will be printed to the error log. If assertions are on and erroneous state is detected, verification will fail with AssertionError exception.

      • logTrackedBufferInfo

        public void logTrackedBufferInfo(String prefix,
                                 ByteBuffer buffer)
        Logs all known tracking information about the given buffer. OGlobalConfiguration.DIRECT_MEMORY_TRACK_MODE must be on, otherwise this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the log message prefix
        buffer - the buffer to print information about
